009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Arrays;
014
015import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
016import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
017import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
019
020import ij.IJ;
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.PntUtils;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
024
025/**
026 * Algebraic ellipse fit based on Fitzgibbon's method [1], numerically
027 * improved by Halir and Flusser [2].
028 * Performs data centering or alternatively accepts a specific reference point.
029 * 
030 * [1] A. W. Fitzgibbon, M. Pilu, and R. B. Fisher. Direct least-
031 * squares fitting of ellipses. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis
032 * and Machine Intelligence 21(5), 476-480 (1999).
033 * 
034 * [2] R. Halíř and J. Flusser. Numerically stable direct least squares
035 * fitting of ellipses. In "Proceedings of the 6th International
036 * Conference in Central Europe on Computer Graphics and Visualization
037 * (WSCG’98)", pp. 125-132, Plzeň, CZ (February 1998).
038 * 
039 * @author WB
040 * @version 2021/11/06
041 */
042public class EllipseFitFitzgibbonStable implements EllipseFitAlgebraic {
043        
044        private static final RealMatrix C1 = 
045                        Matrix.makeRealMatrix(3, 3,
046                                        0.0,  0.0, 2, 
047                                        0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 
048                                        2,    0.0, 0.0);
049        
050        private static final RealMatrix C1i = 
051                        Matrix.makeRealMatrix(3, 3,
052                                        0.0,  0.0, 0.5, 
053                                        0.0, -1.0, 0.0, 
054                                        0.5,  0.0, 0.0);
055        
056        private final double[] p;       // p = (A,B,C,D,E,F) ellipse parameters
057        
058        public EllipseFitFitzgibbonStable(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
059                this.p = fit(points, xref);
060        }
061        
062        public EllipseFitFitzgibbonStable(Pnt2d[] points) {
063                this(points, PntUtils.centroid(points));
064        }
065
066        @Override
067        public double[] getParameters() {
068                return this.p;
069        }
070        
071        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
072                final int n = points.length;
073
074                // reference point
075                final double xr = xref.getX();
076                final double yr = xref.getY();
077
078                RealMatrix X1 = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 3);
079                RealMatrix X2 = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(n, 3);
080                
081                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
082                        final double x = points[i].getX() - xr; // center data set
083                        final double y = points[i].getY() - yr;
084                        double[] f1 = {sqr(x), x*y, sqr(y)};
085                        double[] f2 = {x, y, 1};
086                        X1.setRow(i, f1);
087                        X2.setRow(i, f2);
088                }
089
090                // build reduced scatter matrices:
091                RealMatrix S1 = X1.transpose().multiply(X1);
092                RealMatrix S2 = X1.transpose().multiply(X2);
093                RealMatrix S3 = X2.transpose().multiply(X2);            
094                RealMatrix S3i = MatrixUtils.inverse(S3);
095                
096                RealMatrix T = S3i.scalarMultiply(-1).multiply(S2.transpose());         
097                RealMatrix Z = C1i.multiply(S1.add(S2.multiply(T)));
098                
099                // find the eigenvector of Z which satisfies ellipse constraint:
100                EigenDecomposition ed = new EigenDecomposition(Z);
101                double[] p1 = null;
102                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
103                        RealVector e = ed.getEigenvector(i);
104                        if (e.dotProduct(C1.operate(e)) > 0) {
105                                p1 = e.toArray();
106                                break;
107                        }
108                }
109                
110//              if (T == null) {
111//                      throw new RuntimeException("T is null! " + Arrays.toString(points));
112//              }
113//              if (p1 == null) {
114//                      throw new RuntimeException("p1 is null! " + Arrays.toString(points));
115//              }
116                
117                if (p1 == null) {
118                        IJ.log("p1 is null! " + Arrays.toString(points));
119                        return null;
120                }
121                
122                double[] p2 = T.operate(p1);
123                
124                RealMatrix U = getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(xr, yr);
125                
126                // assemble p and correct for data centering:
127                double[] p = U.operate(Matrix.join(p1, p2));
128                
129                // for plotting only:
130//              for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
131//                      double[] p1i = ed.getEigenvector(i).toArray();
132//                      double[] p2i = T.operate(p1i);
133//                      double[] pi = Matrix.multiply(U, Matrix.join(p1i, p2i));
134//                      IJ.log("p" + i + " = " + Matrix.toString(pi));
135//              }
136                
137                return  Matrix.normalize(p);
138        }
139
140}
